frame.name: Losing_track_of_theme
frame.definition: <def-root>This frames describes a <fen>Perceiver</fen> who fails to keep sight of a <fen>Theme</fen>. The focus of this frame is the <fen>Perceiver</fen>, which appears in subject position. This frame contrasts with the opposing perspective in Losing_track_of_perceiver, where the <fen>Perceiver</fen> is the object and the <fen>Theme</fen> is the subject. <ex><fex name="Perceiver">The police</fex> <t>lost</t> <fex name="Theme">the burglar</fex> <fex name="Explanation">as the thief turned the corner</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Perceiver
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Perceiver</fen> is the entity who fails to keep the <fen>Theme</fen> in sight.</def-root>

FE.name: Theme
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Theme</fen> is the object that becomes unperceivable.</def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Perceiver</fen> loses perception of the <fen>Theme</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Perceiver</fen> loses perception of the <fen>Theme</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE denotes a proposition from which the loss of perception logically follows.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: lose.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: fail to keep sight of (something)
